entries.content: Starting new session with Moti. Working on Semantix VS Code extension - a visual interface for AI pair programming that shows real-time thought process, tool usage, and streaming responses. Key features include permission system, designer controls, multi-state architecture, and semantic memory integration.

Memory system loaded successfully. User opened actions.css from tool-permission system. Ready to continue work on Semantix. Recent achievements include ultra-modular permission dialog refactoring, multi-state architecture, and ChromaDB migration.

Starting new modular logo animation project. Moti wants to create a beautiful, scalable, production-quality animated logo for Semantix. This will be the face of the product, so it needs to be done right from the start with proper architecture. Treating it as a standalone module that can be reused.

Completed ultra-modular refactoring of Semantix logo animation system. Created 9 files following our proven architecture patterns: SemantixCube (micro-component), CubeGridManager (manages 16 instances), SemantixLogoSVG (generator), SemantixLogoConfig (centralized config), CubeFlashController & CubeFadeController (animation controllers), SemantixLogoOrchestrator (main coordinator), plus CSS and demo HTML. Each cube now has complete individual control with flash/fade methods. System is production-ready, scalable, and ready for additional animation types.

Completed dynamic grid size feature for Semantix logo. Added slider control (2×2 to 8×8) that regenerates SVG with proper spacing and gradients. Updated all modules: SemantixLogoConfig (grid constraints), SemantixLogoSVG (dynamic generation), CubeGridManager (variable cube counts), SemantixLogoOrchestrator (setGridSize method), and index.html (slider UI). Grid changes smoothly regenerate the logo while maintaining animations.
